meanings.definition: Unable to be avoided or escaped.
meanings.sent1: The storm was inescapable, and we had to stay indoors.
meanings.sent2: The feeling of hunger was inescapable after a long day of work.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the inescapable lure of the laser pointer irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The inescapable truth finally dawned on him like a sudden burst of light.
meanings.sent5: The inescapable reality of aging became more apparent with each passing year.

meanings.sent1: The inescapable outcome of the experiment was clear from the start.
meanings.sent2: His inescapable fate was sealed the moment he made that decision.
meanings.sent3: The inescapable deadline for the project loomed closer with each passing day.
meanings.sent4: The inescapable consequences of his actions finally caught up with him.
meanings.sent5: The inescapable conclusion was reached after careful consideration of all the evidence.
